decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The premises shall not be used for the purposes hereby permitted other than between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 on Mondays to Fridays and 08:00 and 14:00 on Saturdays and not at all on Sundays, Bank or Public holidays without the prior consent in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control in the interests of amenity, and in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) the use hereby permitted shall be a Boxing Gym only and shall be used for no other purpose(s) whatsoever including any other use in Class D2 of the Order, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area and to enable the Local Planning Authority to exercise control over any future use not forming part of this application, and that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61

Unless within 2 months of the date of this decision, details of refuse and recycling facilities are submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval, and unless the approved scheme is implemented within 1 month of the local planning authority's approval, the use of the site as a Boxing Gym shall cease until such time as a scheme is approved and implemented. The refuse and recycling facilities shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge how refuse and recycling will be managed on site.  Submission of this detail within 2 months of the date of this decision will protect the amenity of occupiers of the development and also the locality generally and ensure that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
The boxing gym hereby approved shall not accommodate more than 10 patrons at any one time unless otherwise submitted to an approved in writing.
To accord with the terms of the application and to ensure the levels of usage and associated amenity impacts within the surrounding area are acceptable.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
description: Retrospective change of use of B1 unit to Boxing Gym D2 use.
